com.pump.io

Class IOUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.io.IOUtils

  • public class IOUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of static methods relating to Files and IO operations.

    These methods should have very few class dependencies; if you're considering adding a method that will require several other classes/packages, please put it in a different location.

    • Field Summary

      This accepts all files that are not hidden.

    • Method Detail

      • formatFileSize

        public static java.lang.String formatFileSize(java.io.File file)
        Parameters:
        file - the file to return the size of.
        Returns:
        a human-readable String representing a file's size. For example, this may return "67.3 KB" or "203.4 MB".

      • formatIndex

        public static java.lang.String formatIndex(int index,
                                           int totalSize)
        Format a number as String that can be always be large enough to hold "totalSize" digits. So for example: "1" should be formatted as "001" if there will eventually be "235" elements, but it should be formatted as "01" if there will only be "23" elements.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to format.
        totalSize - the maximum value we're counting towards.
        Returns:
        a String representation of index.

      • skipFully

        public static long skipFully(java.io.InputStream in,
                             long amount)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        The description of InputStream.skip() is unfulfilling. It is perfectly OK for InputStream.skip() to return zero, but not necessarily mean EOF.

        This method will skip either the number of bytes requested, or if it falls short that indicates we read to the end of the file.

        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to skip bytes from
        amount - the amount of bytes to skip
        Returns:
        the number of bytes skipped.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • delete

        public static boolean delete(java.io.File file)
        Delete this file and all its children, if any.

        Special OS-specific commands may be applied to optimize deletion.

        Parameters:
        file - the file to delete.
        Returns:
        true if the delete was successful.

      • isZip

        public static boolean isZip(java.io.File file)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        file - the file to check.
        Returns:
        true if this file is a zip file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • zipEquals

        public static boolean zipEquals(java.io.File zip1,
                                java.io.File zip2,
                                java.lang.String... ignorableEntries)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Returns true if these zip files act like equivalent sets. The order of the zip entries is not important: if they contain exactly the same contents, this returns true.
        Parameters:
        zip1 - one zip file
        zip2 - another zip file
        ignorableEntries - if non-null then this if a ZipEntry matches any of these patterns it is ignored in the comparison. For example "*.RSA" will skip all entries that end in ".RSA".
        Returns:
        true if the two zip archives are equivalent sets
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getLength

        public static long getLength(java.io.InputStream in)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Return the length of an InputStream. This is measured by invoking InputStream.skip(..) and InputStream.read().
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getCRC

        public static long getCRC(java.io.InputStream in,
                          boolean close)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Calculate the CRC32 checksum of all the data in an InputStream.
        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to read to completion.
        close - whether this method will invoke in.close() on completion.
        Returns:
        the CRC32 checksum for this InputStream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(java.io.File file1,
                             java.io.File file2)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        file1 - the first file
        file2 - the second file
        Returns:
        true if two files are exactly equal. This will call zipEquals() if both files are zip files.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

        Read data into the destination array.
        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to read.
        dest - the destination to write to
        Returns:
        the number of bytes read (note this will be less than dest.length when the end of the stream is reached).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • copy

        public static void copy(java.io.File src,
                        java.io.File dst)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a copy of a file. This is shorthand for copy(src, dst, false).
        Parameters:
        src - the file to copy
        dst - the location to write the new file. This method also invokes parentFile.mkdirs() and dst.createNewFile(). If either of these methods return false then an IOException is thrown before any data transfer is attempted.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • copy

        public static boolean copy(java.io.File src,
                           java.io.File dst,
                           boolean abortIfIdentical)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a copy of a file.
        Parameters:
        src - the file to copy
        dst - the location to write the new file. This method also invokes parentFile.mkdirs() and dst.createNewFile(). If either of these methods return false then an IOException is thrown before any data transfer is attempted.
        abortIfIdentical - if true then this method first calls equals(src, dst), and exits this method if the two files are identical. This avoids any writing, but it introduces a separate pass (reading) before any writing begins.
        Returns:
        false if we aborted without writing anything, true if the operation wrote/copied the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeLines

        public static boolean writeLines(java.io.File file,
                                 java.lang.String[] lines,
                                 boolean abortIfNoChange)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Rewrite a file using the lines provided.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to write to
        lines - the new lines to write.
        abortIfNoChange - if true then this method first checks whether the current file exactly matches what will be written.
        Returns:
        true if the file was written, false if this method returned without writing anything.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.
        See Also:
        readLines(File, int)

      • readLines

        public static java.lang.String[] readLines(java.io.File file,
                                           int maxArraySize)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        file - the file to read
        maxArraySize - the maximum number of lines this method will return. If this is negative then it is ignored and all lines will always be read.
        Returns:
        all the lines of text in a text file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.
        See Also:
        writeLines(File, String[], boolean)

      • readLines

        public static java.lang.String[] readLines(java.io.InputStream in,
                                           int maxArraySize)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to read.
        maxArraySize - the maximum number of lines this method will return. If this is negative then it is ignored and all lines will always be read.
        Returns:
        all the lines of text in a text file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.
        See Also:
        writeLines(File, String[], boolean)

      • write

        public static boolean write(java.io.File file,
                            java.lang.String text,
                            boolean abortIfNoChange)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Write the text provided to a File.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to write to.
        text - the text to write.
        abortIfNoChange - if true then this method first checks whether the current file exactly matches what will be written.
        Returns:
        true if the file was written, false if this method returned without writing anything.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • getUniqueTempFile

        public static java.io.File getUniqueTempFile(java.lang.String name)
        Returns:
        a temp file path that does not yet exist with the base name provided.

      • getUniqueFile

        public static java.io.File getUniqueFile(java.io.File parentFile,
                                         java.lang.String name,
                                         boolean includeSpaces,
                                         boolean uniquePerSession)
        Returns a file that does not yet exist.

        If a file of the given name and parent does not already exist, then this method simply returns new File(parentFile, name).

        Parameters:
        parentFile - the directory to create the file in.
        name - the starting name, which this method might modify to guarantee unique-ness.
        includeSpaces - if false then there will be no spaces in the returned file name. (If there were already spaces in the path of the parent, though: those are unchanged.)
        uniquePerSession - if true then the File returned will be unique in this session. This is useful for multithreaded environments if the user isn't going to interact with these directories (such as temp directories). But it is bad if this helps rename a saved file. (Just because we previously used "Untitled 2" does NOT mean that if the user has since deleted "Untitled" and "Untitled 2" that we need to iterate to the unique "Untitled 3" option.)
        Returns:
        a File object that maps to something that does not yet exist.

      • reveal

        public static boolean reveal(java.io.File file)
        Reveal (select) a file in the operating system. This will be platform-specific, and for now is only supported on Mac.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to reveal.
        Returns:
        true if this method is reasonably confident the request was successful. False otherwise.

      • isAlias

        public static boolean isAlias(java.io.File file)
        Return true if this file is an alias to another file.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to check against.
        Returns:
        true if this file is an alias to another file.
